_metadata._comment: language-config.json â€” Defines all supported languages for the app.
_metadata._comment_2: All user-facing strings are stored as i18n keys in ARB files (lib/l10n/).
_metadata._comment_3: Config files (global-config, master-tasks-config etc.) use i18n keys, NOT raw strings.
_metadata._comment_4: To add a new language: add an entry here and create the corresponding ARB file.
_metadata._comment_6: font_scale_factor: some scripts (e.g. Gujarati, Hindi) need slightly larger base size for legibility.
_metadata._comment_7: arb_file: relative path from lib/l10n/ to the ARB translation file for this language.
_metadata._comment_8: display_name: name of the language written in its OWN script (shown to user in language picker).
_metadata._comment_9: enabled: false = language defined but not yet available in the app (translations pending).

_comment_default_language: The language preselected on the Welcome Screen. Loaded from this config. Can be overridden by user preference once set.

supported_languages._comment: British English. dd/MM/yyyy date format standard for UK.
Polish â€” one of the most widely spoken non-English languages in the UK.
Romanian â€” significant UK population particularly post-2014 EU freedom of movement.

supported_languages._comment_rtl: RTL CRITICAL: All layout widgets must use Directionality-aware equivalents. Test thoroughly on both platforms.
supported_languages._comment: Urdu â€” widely spoken in UK Pakistani and Kashmiri communities. Nastaliq script preferred but Naskh acceptable.
Hindi â€” Devanagari script. Widely spoken among UK Indian communities.
Gujarati â€” significant UK community particularly in Leicester, London, and the Midlands.
supported_languages._comment_week: first_day_of_week is Sunday as is traditional in Gujarati calendars.

supported_languages._comment: Punjabi â€” Gurmukhi script. Large UK Sikh and Punjabi communities particularly in the Midlands.
supported_languages._comment_2: Note: Punjabi written in Shahmukhi script (used in Pakistan) is RTL â€” this config covers Gurmukhi (India/UK Sikh community).

_comment_fallback: If a translation key is missing in the selected language ARB file, fall back to English. Never show a raw key to the user.
_comment_rtl_languages: Convenience list used by the app's Directionality widget wrapper at startup. Update this list if RTL languages are added.

timezone_display._comment: Controls how timezone labels are shown in the UI when user selects home_timezone in setup wizard.
timezone_display._comment_format: Options: 'city_only' | 'offset_only' | 'city_and_offset'. Example city_and_offset: 'London (UTC+0)' or 'London (UTC+1)' in BST.
timezone_display._comment_dst: If true, shows BST/GMT indicator next to UK timezone in UI. Important for UK users who may not understand DST switching.

language_picker_ui._comment: Controls how the language picker is rendered on the Welcome Screen.
language_picker_ui._comment_flag: If true, shows flag emoji next to language name. Flags for locale codes: en=ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§, pl=ğŸ‡µğŸ‡±, ro=ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡´, ur=ğŸ‡µğŸ‡°, hi=ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³, gu=ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³, pa=ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³
language_picker_ui._comment_native: If true, shows language name in its own script (display_name). Recommended â€” users can find their language even if they can't read English.
language_picker_ui._comment_english: If true, shows English name in smaller text below native name.
language_picker_ui._comment_style: Options: 'list' | 'grid'. List recommended for languages with long native names.

i18n_key_convention._comment: Documents the key naming convention used across all ARB files and config files.
i18n_key_convention._comment_common: Keys prefixed with 'common.' are shared across multiple screens. Always check common keys before creating a new screen-specific key.
i18n_key_convention._comment_task: Task names in master-tasks-config.json use pattern: task.<category_id>.<task_id>.name
i18n_key_convention._comment_notification: Notification templates use pattern: notification.<type>.<element> e.g. notification.missed_task.body
